description: '''Balearic beat''', also known as '''Balearic house''', '''Balearic''', '''Ibiza house''' or '''Ibizan chillout''', is an eclectic blend of DJ-led [[dance music]] that emerged in the mid-1980s. It later became the name of a more specific style of [[electronic dance]]/[[house music]] that was popular into the mid-1990s. Balearic beat was named for its popularity among European [[nightclub]] and beach [[rave party|rave]] patrons on the [[Balearic Islands|Balearic island]] of [[Ibiza]], a popular tourist destination. Some dance music compilations referred to it as "the sound of Ibiza", even though many other, more aggressive and upbeat forms of dance music could be heard on the island, such as [[Balearic trance]].
